SEARCH
Package org.bvsd

Class Graphics

java.lang.Object
org.bvsd.Graphics
public class Graphics extends Object
Graphics This class is intended for beginning Java programming students who would like to engage in simple graphics programming. It provides more explicit methods and more intuitive parameters that wrap around JFree's SVG library (which itself is a subclass of the Java AWT Library

    • drawCircle

      Draws a circle with center at (centerX, centerY) with radius.
      Parameters:
      centerX - the x coordinate of the center
      centerY - the y coordinate of the center
      radius - the radius of the circle

      centerY - the y coordinate of the center
      width - the width of the oval
      height - the height of the oval

      leftTopY - the y coordinate of the upper left corner

      leftTopX - the x coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle
      leftTopY - the y coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle
      width - the width of the rectangle
      height - the height of the rectangle

      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the center
      y - the y-coordinate of the center
      size - the side length of the triangle

    • drawIrregularTriangle

      public void drawIrregularTriangle(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int x3, int y3)
      Draws a triangle with vertices at (x1,y1), (x2,y2), and (x3,y3)
      Parameters:
      x1 - the x coordinate of the first point on the triangle
      y1 - the y coordinate of the first point on the triangle
      x2 - the x coordinate of the second point on the triangle
      y2 - the y coordinate of the second point on the triangle
      x3 - the x coordinate of the third point on the triangle
      y3 - the y coordinate of the third point on the triangle

    • drawPentagon

      public void drawPentagon(int centerX, int centerY, int radius)
      Draws a regular pentagon: so, the shape has 5 equal sides and 5 interior angles, each with a measure of 72 degrees
      Parameters:
      centerX - , the x-coordinate of the center of the pentagon
      centerY - , the y-coordinate of the center of the pentagon
      radius - , the length of the line from the center to any point on the perimeter of the pentagon With the radius and the Math class built into Java, the x and y values for all five vertices of the pentagon is calculated using trig to draw a pentagon

    • drawHexagon

      public void drawHexagon(int centerX, int centerY, int distToVertex)
      Draws a regular hexagon: so, the shape has 6 equal sides and 6 interior angles, each with a measure of 120 degrees
      Parameters:
      centerX - , the x-coordinate of the center of the hexagon
      centerY - , the y-coordinate of the center of the hexagon
      distToVertex - , the length of the line from the center to any vertex/corner of the hexagon With the distance to a corner and the Math class built into Java, the x and y values for all six vertices of the hexagon can be calculated, and so the method can draw a regular hexagon

    • drawArc

      public void drawArc(int x, int y, int width, int height, int startAngle, int arcAngle)
      Draws an arc with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the upper left corner
      y - The y-coordinate of the upper left corner
      width - The width of the arc
      height - The height of the arc
      startAngle - the position of the arc to start at
      arcAngle - the amount of the arc to draw

    • drawOctagon

      public void drawOctagon(int centerX, int centerY, int distToVertex)
      Draws an octagon at centerX, centerY, with the distance to the vertex.
      Parameters:
      centerX - the x-coordinate of the center
      centerY - the y-coordinate fo the center
      distToVertex - the distance from the center to the vertex

    • drawLine

      public void drawLine(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Draws a line between (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)
      Parameters:
      x1 - The x-coordinate of the starting point
      y1 - The y-coordinate of the starting point
      x2 - The x-coordinate of the ending point
      y2 - The y-coordinate of the ending point

    • rotate

      public void rotate(int degree)
      Rotates the canvas by (degree). Positive degree rotates canvas clockwise Negative degree rotates canvas anticlockwise
      Parameters:
      degree - rotates the canvas by degrees

    • drawText

      public void drawText(String txt, int x, int y, int size, int red, int green, int blue, int style, String font)
      Adds text at (x, y) for the bottom left corner.
      Parameters:
      txt - the string to be drawn
      x - the x coordinate of the leftmost character baseline
      y - the y coordinate of the leftmost character baseline
      size - the size of the text
      red - the red value of the text color (0-255)
      green - the green value of the text color (0-255)
      blue - the blue value of the text color (0-255)
      style - the the style of the text (plain,bold,italic) uses the public static constants of the class
      font - the font of the text Fonts that work are: "Dialog", "DialogInput", "Monospaced", "SansSerif", "Serif"

    • addGrid

      public void addGrid(int increments)
      Overlays a grid in reflex blue color. The gridlines will be added at increments specified in the parameter.
      Parameters:
      increments - How frequently to draw a grid line

    • saveToFile

      public void saveToFile(String filename)
      Saves the current image to a file given by filename in SVG format.
      Parameters:
      filename - String representing the filename to save to.
